definition: to send/to mail/to entrust/to depend on/to attach oneself to/to live (in a house)/to lodge/foster (son etc)
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: And we are just the parasite of the self-images in ther mirror.
sentences.chinese: 我们不过是镜里自己形象的寄生物。

sentences.english: Insect immunity is a defense mechanisms against attack by parasitoids.
sentences.chinese: 昆虫免疫是寄主昆虫抵御寄生物侵袭的一种防卫机制。

sentences.english: What is the most resilient parasite?
sentences.chinese: 什么是最有韧劲白勺寄生物？

sentences.english: The relationship between host and parasite can be disarranged in many ways.
sentences.chinese: 可以用许多方法破坏寄生和寄生物之间的相互关系。

sentences.english: Because at least one kind of invasive shrimp is an even bigger pest when it has a parasite on board.
sentences.chinese: 因为有一种虾类，在带有寄生物时能够更有力地入侵。

sentences.english: She works in the animal parasitic diseases laboratory in Beltsville, Maryland.
sentences.chinese: 她在马里兰的动物寄生物病实验室工作。

definition: to live in or on another organism as a parasite/to live by taking advantage of others/parasitism/parasitic
